subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 3.8.2, getting started
msgSnippet: ... Feel free to announce things here. Just keep em on-topic and put ANN: in the subject line. One or two people will complain. I recommend you ignore them.
messageBody:
David Saff wrote:
> All,
>
> I'll be using my blog (http://woobawooba.saff.net/) to post developments
> in the implementation and documentation of JUnit. The first such post
> is up now, with information about JUnit 4.1, the current state of the
> documentation, and getting quick-started with JUnit 3.8.2:
>
> http://shareandenjoy.saff.net
>
> This will be the only post to this list with no more information than a
> link to my blog. Cross my heart.

Feel free to announce things here. Just keep 'em on-topic and put ANN:
in the subject line. One or two people will complain. I recommend you
ignore them. If the traffic gets very high in here again, we'll
reconsider that policy. :)
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
